content.description: The climb is to the left of the boulderfield you cross as you approach the cliffs. Sadly, this area is now closed.

To the left of

If It's Free

and right off the trail is an overhang move to the blunt arete that forms the South edge of the main East-facing wall. This route is great. It starts with a 5.11 crux between bolts one and two, follows some good edge and arete climbing to a spot shortly below the anchors. A big reach on thin hands delivers a second crux, that is not without it's own spook factor. Stay cool and head for the anchor, this is a fine lesson in problem solving where all the edges seem to disappear. Just stay on the feet, this wall is never past vertical.
content.protection: Take seven draws and something for the double bolt anchor at the top.

content.description:
To the right of the main wall hosting

If It's Free

, is a blunt arete/face in rather blackish rock, this is unusual since most of the stone up here is red.  Two easy clips lead into the middle of this ultra-technical friction route. Don't be fooled; just because most routes here are largely straightforward, Positions really is 5.12, and really is tricky. I tried to fire straight through the friction and flailed miserably. Whether or not it was intended, the right edge of the face kicks up just enough purchase for one hand to pull through the friction sequence, but it is still 5.12 climbing. What saves it from being really difficult, is the presence of a good horizontal system above the fifth clip, and this minimizes the amount of sketchy foot work. This is not powerful climbing, however, it is technical and very dependent on obtaining good frictional footwork. I thought that Positions Available was a blast.
content.protection: Take six draws and something for the double bolt anchor at the top.

content.description: Walk West  around the mesa until the ridge line crumbles away,  about 200 yards from the main talus field. Route numbering begins from this West side with the four bolt Suicide Drive (5.9) being # 1. Material Issue takes the colorful arete 30 ft right of Suicide Drive. It's a small thing with a technical arete move between bolts 3 and 4. I thought it was a kick and a nice problem, if only it were 100 ft longer.
content.protection: QD only. This 40 ft route needs only 5 draws and something for the anchor at the top.

climbs.name: If It's Free It's For Me

content.description: From the center of the talus field, the largest sector of the cliff has an East-facing wall that just begs to be climbed. It has several good routes on it, If It's Free and Question Reality both fire more or less up the middle of the wall, If It's Free is the left of the two. Chase half a dozen bolts out of a corner system to the top of the cliff. Big holds, good stone, fun climbing. One of the better lines on Table Mountain South.
content.protection: Six draws and something for the double bolt anchor at the top.
